service: Amazon Web Services Outposts is a fully managed service that extends Amazon Web Services infrastructure, APIs, and tools to customer premises. By providing local access to Amazon Web Services managed infrastructure, Amazon Web Services Outposts enables customers to build and run applications on premises using the same programming interfaces as in Amazon Web Services Regions, while using local compute and storage resources for lower latency and local data processing needs.

operations.CancelOrder: Cancels the specified order for an Outpost.
operations.CreateOutpost:
Creates an Outpost.

You can specify either an Availability one or an AZ ID.
operations.CreateSite: Creates a site for an Outpost.
operations.GetCatalogItem: Gets information about the specified catalog item.
operations.GetConnection:
Amazon Web Services uses this action to install Outpost servers.

Gets information about the specified connection.

Use CloudTrail to monitor this action or Amazon Web Services managed policy for Amazon Web Services Outposts to secure it. For more information, see Amazon Web Services managed policies for Amazon Web Services Outposts and Logging Amazon Web Services Outposts API calls with Amazon Web Services CloudTrail in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.
operations.GetOutpostInstanceTypes: Gets the instance types for the specified Outpost.
operations.GetSite: Gets information about the specified Outpost site.
operations.GetSiteAddress: Gets the site address of the specified site.
operations.ListAssets:
Lists the hardware assets for the specified Outpost.

Use filters to return specific results. If you specify multiple filters, the results include only the resources that match all of the specified filters. For a filter where you can specify multiple values, the results include items that match any of the values that you specify for the filter.
operations.ListCatalogItems:
Lists the items in the catalog.

Use filters to return specific results. If you specify multiple filters, the results include only the resources that match all of the specified filters. For a filter where you can specify multiple values, the results include items that match any of the values that you specify for the filter.
operations.ListOrders: Lists the Outpost orders for your Amazon Web Services account.
operations.ListOutposts:
Lists the Outposts for your Amazon Web Services account.

Use filters to return specific results. If you specify multiple filters, the results include only the resources that match all of the specified filters. For a filter where you can specify multiple values, the results include items that match any of the values that you specify for the filter.
operations.ListSites:
Lists the Outpost sites for your Amazon Web Services account. Use filters to return specific results.

Use filters to return specific results. If you specify multiple filters, the results include only the resources that match all of the specified filters. For a filter where you can specify multiple values, the results include items that match any of the values that you specify for the filter.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists the tags for the specified resource.
operations.StartConnection:
Amazon Web Services uses this action to install Outpost servers.

Starts the connection required for Outpost server installation.

Use CloudTrail to monitor this action or Amazon Web Services managed policy for Amazon Web Services Outposts to secure it. For more information, see Amazon Web Services managed policies for Amazon Web Services Outposts and Logging Amazon Web Services Outposts API calls with Amazon Web Services CloudTrail in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.
operations.UpdateSiteAddress:
Updates the address of the specified site.

You can't update a site address if there is an order in progress. You must wait for the order to complete or cancel the order.

You can update the operating address before you place an order at the site, or after all Outposts that belong to the site have been deactivated.
operations.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalProperties:
Update the physical and logistical details for a rack at a site. For more information about hardware requirements for racks, see Network readiness checklist in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.

To update a rack at a site with an order of IN_PROGRESS, you must wait for the order to complete or cancel the order.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have permission to perform this operation.

AccountId.base: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account.

refs.CreateSiteInput$OperatingAddress: The location to install and power on the hardware. This address might be different from the shipping address.
refs.CreateSiteInput$ShippingAddress: The location to ship the hardware. This address might be different from the operating address.

refs.GetSiteAddressInput$AddressType: The type of the address you request.
refs.GetSiteAddressOutput$AddressType: The type of the address you receive.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

refs.StartConnectionRequest$AssetId: The ID of the Outpost server.

AssetLocation.base: Information about the position of the asset in a rack.

refs.AssetInfo$AssetLocation: The position of an asset in a rack.

refs.ListOutpostsInput$AvailabilityZoneIdFilt: Filters the results by AZ ID (for example, use1-az1).

refs.ListOutpostsInput$AvailabilityZoneFilter: Filters the results by Availability Zone (for example, us-east-1a).

refs.CatalogItem$PowerKva: Information about the power draw of an item.

refs.CatalogItem$ItemStatus: The status of a catalog item.

refs.CatalogItem$WeightLbs: The weight of the item in pounds.

refs.Site$OperatingAddressCity: City where the hardware is installed and powered on.

refs.ComputeAttributes$State:
The state.

  • ACTIVE - The asset is available and can provide capacity for new compute resources.

  • ISOLATED - The asset is undergoing maintenance and can't provide capacity for new compute resources. Existing compute resources on the asset are not affected.

  • RETIRING - The underlying hardware for the asset is degraded. Capacity for new compute resources is reduced. Amazon Web Services sends notifications for resources that must be stopped before the asset can be replaced.

ConflictException.base: Updating or deleting this resource can cause an inconsistent state.

refs.Address$CountryCode: The ISO-3166 two-letter country code for the address.
refs.Site$OperatingAddressCountryCode: The ISO-3166 two-letter country code where the hardware is installed and powered on.

refs.StartConnectionRequest$DeviceSerialNumbe: The serial number of the dongle.

refs.Address$DistrictOrCounty: The district or county for the address.

refs.CatalogItem$EC2Capacities: Information about the EC2 capacity of an item.

refs.ListCatalogItemsInput$EC2FamilyFilter: Filters the results by EC2 family (for example, M5).

refs.EC2Capacity$Family: The family of the EC2 capacity.

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$FiberOpticCableTy: The type of fiber used to attach the Outpost to the network.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Fi: The type of fiber that you will use to attach the Outpost to your network.

refs.ComputeAttributes$HostId: The host ID of the Dedicated Host on the asset.

refs.ListAssetsInput$HostIdFilter: Filters the results by the host ID of a Dedicated Host.

refs.OrderSummary$OrderSubmissionDate: The submission date for the order.
refs.OrderSummary$OrderFulfilledDate: The fulfilment date for the order.

refs.ListOutpostsInput$LifeCycleStatusFilter: Filters the results by the lifecycle status.

LineItemAssetInformation.base: Information about a line item asset.

refs.LineItemRequest$Quantity: The quantity of a line item request.

refs.CreateOrderInput$LineItems: The line items that make up the order.

refs.OrderSummary$LineItemCountsByStatus: The status of all line items in the order.

refs.LineItemAssetInformation$MacAddressList: The MAC addresses of the asset.

refs.EC2Capacity$MaxSize: The maximum size of the EC2 capacity.

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$MaximumSupportedW: The maximum rack weight that this site can support. NO_LIMIT is over 2000 lbs (907 kg).
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Ma: The maximum rack weight that this site can support. NO_LIMIT is over 2000lbs.

refs.StartConnectionRequest$NetworkInterfaceD: The device index of the network interface on the Outpost server.

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$OpticalStandard: The type of optical standard used to attach the Outpost to the network. This field is dependent on uplink speed, fiber type, and distance to the upstream device. For more information about networking requirements for racks, see Network in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Op:
The type of optical standard that you will use to attach the Outpost to your network. This field is dependent on uplink speed, fiber type, and distance to the upstream device. For more information about networking requirements for racks, see Network in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.

  • OPTIC_10GBASE_SR: 10GBASE-SR

  • OPTIC_10GBASE_IR: 10GBASE-IR

  • OPTIC_10GBASE_LR: 10GBASE-LR

  • OPTIC_40GBASE_SR: 40GBASE-SR

  • OPTIC_40GBASE_ESR: 40GBASE-ESR

  • OPTIC_40GBASE_IR4_LR4L: 40GBASE-IR (LR4L)

  • OPTIC_40GBASE_LR4: 40GBASE-LR4

  • OPTIC_100GBASE_SR4: 100GBASE-SR4

  • OPTIC_100GBASE_CWDM4: 100GBASE-CWDM4

  • OPTIC_100GBASE_LR4: 100GBASE-LR4

  • OPTIC_100G_PSM4_MSA: 100G PSM4 MSA

  • OPTIC_1000BASE_LX: 1000Base-LX

  • OPTIC_1000BASE_SX : 1000Base-SX

refs.Order$Status:
The status of the order.

  • PREPARING - Order is received and being prepared.

  • IN_PROGRESS - Order is either being built, shipped, or installed. To get more details, see the line item status.

  • COMPLETED - Order is complete.

  • CANCELLED - Order is cancelled.

  • ERROR - Customer should contact support.

The following status are deprecated: RECEIVED, PENDING, PROCESSING, INSTALLING, and FULFILLED.
refs.OrderSummary$Status:
The status of the order.

  • PREPARING - Order is received and is being prepared.

  • IN_PROGRESS - Order is either being built, shipped, or installed. For more information, see the LineItem status.

  • COMPLETED - Order is complete.

  • CANCELLED - Order is cancelled.

  • ERROR - Customer should contact support.

The following statuses are deprecated: RECEIVED, PENDING, PROCESSING, INSTALLING, and FULFILLED.

OrderSummary.base: A summary of line items in your order.

OutpostArn.base: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

refs.DeleteOutpostInput$OutpostId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.
refs.GetOutpostInput$OutpostId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.
refs.GetOutpostInstanceTypesInput$OutpostId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.
refs.UpdateOutpostInput$OutpostId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

refs.Order$OutpostId: The ID of the Outpost in the order.

refs.CreateOrderInput$OutpostIdentifier: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.
refs.ListAssetsInput$OutpostIdentifier: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.
refs.ListOrdersInput$OutpostIdentifierFilter: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

OwnerId.base: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the Outpost owner.

refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Po:
The power connector that Amazon Web Services should plan to provide for connections to the hardware. Note the correlation between PowerPhase and PowerConnector.

  • Single-phase AC feed

    • L6-30P – (common in US); 30A; single phase

    • IEC309 (blue) – P+N+E, 6hr; 32 A; single phase

  • Three-phase AC feed

    • AH530P7W (red) – 3P+N+E, 7hr; 30A; three phase

    • AH532P6W (red) – 3P+N+E, 6hr; 32A; three phase

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$PowerDrawKva: The power draw available at the hardware placement position for the rack.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Po: The power draw, in kVA, available at the hardware placement position for the rack.
Indicates whether the power feed comes above or below the rack.

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$PowerPhase: The power option that you can provide for hardware.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Po:
The power option that you can provide for hardware.

  • Single-phase AC feed: 200 V to 277 V, 50 Hz or 60 Hz

  • Three-phase AC feed: 346 V to 480 V, 50 Hz or 60 Hz

refs.EC2Capacity$Quantity: The quantity of the EC2 capacity.

refs.AssetLocation$RackElevation: The position of an asset in a rack measured in rack units.

refs.AssetInfo$RackId: The rack ID of the asset.

RackPhysicalProperties.base: Information about the physical and logistical details for racks at sites. For more information about hardware requirements for racks, see Network readiness checklist in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.

refs.CreateSiteInput$RackPhysicalProperties: Information about the physical and logistical details for the rack at this site. For more information about hardware requirements for racks, see Network readiness checklist in the Amazon Web Services Outposts User Guide.
refs.Site$RackPhysicalProperties: Information about the physical and logistical details for a rack at the site.

refs.ConflictException$ResourceType: The type of the resource causing the conflict.

ShipmentInformation.base: Information about a line item shipment.

refs.LineItem$ShipmentInformation: Information about a line item shipment.

SiteArn.base: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.

refs.CreateOutpostInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.DeleteSiteInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.GetSiteAddressInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.GetSiteInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.UpdateSiteAddressInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.UpdateSiteInput$SiteId: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Si: The ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the site.

refs.CreateSiteInput$Notes: Additional information that you provide about site access requirements, electrician scheduling, personal protective equipment, or regulation of equipment materials that could affect your installation process.

refs.CatalogItem$CatalogItemId: The ID of the catalog item.
refs.LineItem$CatalogItemId: The ID of the catalog item.

refs.Site$OperatingAddressStateOrRegion: State or region where the hardware is installed and powered on.

refs.ListSitesInput$OperatingAddressStateOrRe: Filters the results by state or region.

refs.ConflictException$ResourceId: The ID of the resource causing the conflict.

refs.CreateOutpostInput$SupportedHardwareType: The type of hardware for this Outpost.
refs.UpdateOutpostInput$SupportedHardwareType: The type of hardware for this Outpost.

refs.CatalogItem$SupportedStorage: The supported storage options for the catalog item.

refs.CatalogItem$SupportedUplinkGbps: The uplink speed this catalog item requires for the connection to the Region.

refs.CreateOutpostInput$Tags: The tags to apply to the Outpost.
refs.CreateSiteInput$Tags: The tags to apply to a site.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: The tags to add to the resource.

refs.ShipmentInformation$ShipmentTrackingNumb: The tracking number of the shipment.

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$UplinkCount: The number of uplinks each Outpost network device.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Up:
Racks come with two Outpost network devices. Depending on the supported uplink speed at the site, the Outpost network devices provide a variable number of uplinks. Specify the number of uplinks for each Outpost network device that you intend to use to connect the rack to your network. Note the correlation between UplinkGbps and UplinkCount.

  • 1Gbps - Uplinks available: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8

  • 10Gbps - Uplinks available: 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16

  • 40 and 100 Gbps- Uplinks available: 1, 2, 4

refs.RackPhysicalProperties$UplinkGbps: The uplink speed the rack supports for the connection to the Region.
refs.UpdateSiteRackPhysicalPropertiesInput$Up: The uplink speed the rack should support for the connection to the Region.

refs.ConnectionDetails$ClientPublicKey: The public key of the client.
refs.ConnectionDetails$ServerPublicKey: The public key of the server.
refs.StartConnectionRequest$ClientPublicKey: The public key of the client.
